bug.author: ciara1234
bug.summary: [BUG] backup.sh fails if zip isn't installed
bug.description:
Describe the bug Backup.sh fails if zip isn't installed. It appears zip doesn't come as default package in Ubuntu WSL. Created PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/evilsocket/pwnagotchi/pull/454>#454</denchmark-link> for this To Reproduce run ./backup.sh Expected behavior backup.sh should output a zip file Screenshots n/a Environment (please complete the following information):
Pwnagotchi version : 1.0.1 OS version: Just using Ubuntu WSL in Windows 10 Type of hardware Any additional hardware used
Additional context Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment: Why not just use tar in fallback if zip isn't installed? It should be installed on basically every unix system.

Why not just use tar in fallback if zip isn't installed? It should be installed on basically every unix system.
tar won't have compression though - what's more important, getting a backup or having a compressed backup?
